Art. 4.33. 
Formalities 
Where the State claims to be entitled to the estate, it is required to have the seals affixed and to have an inventory drawn up in the manner prescribed for the acceptance of estates with the benefit of an inventory.   The State must apply to the Family Court in whose jurisdiction the estate is located for the estate to be placed in possession. The court may only rule on the request after three publications and notices have been posted in the usual manner, and after hearing the King's Public Prosecutor.
If the State has not complied with the prescribed formalities, it may be ordered to pay damages to the heirs, if any are available.
